definitions.definition: To measure or record the time, duration , or rate of something.
examples: I used a stopwatch to time myself running around the block.

definitions.definition: To choose when something commences or its duration .
examples: The President timed his speech badly, coinciding with the Super Bowl.
The bomb was timed to explode at 9:20 p.m.

definitions.definition: To keep or beat time; to proceed or move in time.
To regulate as to time; to accompany , or agree with , in time of movement .
To measure , as in music or harmony .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To measure or record the time, duration , or rate of something.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To choose when something commences or its duration .
( obsolete ) To keep or beat time; to proceed or move in time.
( obsolete ) To pass time; to delay .
To regulate as to time; to accompany , or agree with , in time of movement .
To measure , as in music or harmony .
